title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHARLOTTE STEALS ONE IN BOSTON BEHIND DIVAC'S HISTORIC NIGHT

BOSTON (AP) – On a night when legends are made, Vlade Divac authored a masterpiece for the ages. The Charlotte Hornets’ big man was simply unplayable, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 43 points to will his team to a stunning 102-98 road victory over the Boston Celtics.

From the opening tip, this was the Divac show. The Celtics had no answer for the seven-foot center, who dominated the paint with an array of feathery hooks and powerful post moves. Every time Boston threatened to build momentum, Divac had an answer, his soft touch around the rim proving to be the game’s constant. His 43 points were not just a personal best; they were a historic pillar upon which the Hornets built their biggest win of the season.

While Divac’s offensive explosion was the headline, his backcourt partner, Muggsy Bogues, provided the perfect counterpoint. The smallest man on the floor orchestrated the attack with a mesmerizing 20-assist performance, finding Divac in his spots time and again. The Bogues-to-Divac connection was the engine of the Charlotte offense, a two-man game that Boston could diagnose but never stop.

The Celtics, led by Rick Fox’s 26 points, fought valiantly. They chipped away at Charlotte’s lead throughout the second half, but every run was met with a calming bucket from Divac. In the final, frantic moments, it was Divac who secured crucial rebounds and knocked down free throws to seal the win, his 43rd point serving as the final, emphatic stamp on a legendary performance.

In the hallowed halls of the Boston Garden, it was Vlade Divac who etched his name into the record books, carrying his team to a memorable victory they will not soon forget.
